body_html:
After configuring, you need to make sure that you have this command executed ccorrectly:
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
Then, you need to make sure you enter the pip install command with sudo -H option.
Given your RAM, I suggest you limit the system to use only less memory with the following command instead:
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package --local_resources 1024,.5,1.0
body_text:
After configuring, you need to make sure that you have this command executed ccorrectly:
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
Then, you need to make sure you enter the pip install command with sudo -H option.
Given your RAM, I suggest you limit the system to use only less memory with the following command instead:
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package --local_resources 1024,.5,1.0
body:
After configuring, you need to make sure that you have this command executed ccorrectly:
`bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package`
Then, you need to make sure you enter the pip install command with sudo -H option.
Given your RAM, I suggest you limit the system to use only less memory with the following command instead:
`bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package --local_resources 1024,.5,1.0`
